duties_responsibilities.duty: Gain a basic understanding of trial balance, general ledger, tax preparation, depreciation, and amortization software used by the Tax department.
Calculate and prepare fixed asset depreciation schedules on different book and tax bases.
Input client’s working trial balance into software and make adjustments.
Manage time invested in engagements wisely, including sensitivity to budget constraints and maintaining an accurate work-in-progress schedule of work assigned.
Cope with the demanding multi-tasking nature of public accounting.
Practice basic preparation skills for federal and state tax returns.

education_certification.credential: Student must be declared Accounting major. Student must be working toward a degree plan which includes the 150 college credit hours required to take the Uniform CPA exam. Student must maintain GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
